input.description: The name of the Adapter to use for this Process.
A URI (can be a filename or URL) pointing to a WSDL XML definition.
Specifies the fully formatted SOAP message to transmit or the SOAP body payload as required by the web service. One and only one element must be contained within this block.
Specifies the target service endpoint address. This can be used if the SOAP request is to be invoked on an endpoint address other than the one specified in the WSDL document.
A unique name among all services defined within in the enclosing WSDL document. A service groups a set of related ports together.
A unique name among all ports defined within in the enclosing WSDL document. A port defines an individual endpoint by specifying a single address for a binding.
Specifies the value of the SOAPAction header for the operation.
The SOAP version to use. Valid values: 1.1, 1.2
The different ways in which a web service request can be invoked. Valid values: synchronous, asynchronous, one-way Default Value: synchronous

Specifies whether to download attachments embedded as MIME parts in the response received from web server.
Valid values: true, false Default value: false

An XML document representing the files to be attached to the SOAP request. The user, if required by web server, can specify the 'Content-Id' header element for the attachment.
<attachments> <attachment> <file>D:\Add Attachments\attach.txt</file> <content-id>attach1=1@localhost</content-id> </attachment> <attachment> <file>D:\Add Attachments\attach.html</file> <content-id>attach2=2@localhost</content-id> </attachment> . . . . </attachments>
Specifies whether to establish a secure connection. Valid values: true, false Default value: false
Specifies whether to install certificates. Valid values: true, false Default value: false
Specifies whether to allow unsigned certificates from trusted zones. Valid values: true, false Default value: false
Specifies the path to the truststore file containing the CAs. In the absence of this element, the Java standard truststore is used.
Specifies the password of the truststore file. Default value: changeit
Specifies the path to the keystore containing the client certificate.
Specifies the password of the keystore file. Default value: changeit
Specifies the alias name in the keystore that identifies the Public Key Certificate (PKC), the web server uses to authenticate the client.
Builds a WS UsernameToken and inserts it into the SOAP Envelope. Valid values: true, false
Username for authentication.
Password for authentication

The method of encryption used for the password value provided. Valid values: Base64, Plain With a value of 'Base64' for this input, the value provided for the password input should be a Base64 encoded value. With a value of 'Plain' the value provided for the password input should be plain text.

Types of password supported by username-token authentication. This parameter is read if and only if, 'username-token' value is provided for 'authentication' parameter. Valid values: plain-text, digest Default value: plain-text
Adds a Nonce element to the UsernameToken. Valid values: true, false
Adds a Created element to the UsernameToken. Valid values: true, false
Builds a WS Timestamp and inserts it into the SOAP Envelope. Valid values: true, false
Sets the time to live. This is the time difference in seconds between the 'Created' and the 'Expires' in Timestamp. Default value: 60
Creates a Signature according to WS Specification, X509 profile, and adds it to the Security header. Valid values: true, false
Signs the WS UsernameToken element in the Security header. Valid values: true, false
Signs the WS Timestamp element in the Security header. Valid values: true, false

Specifies the format in which the public (X.509 certificate) and private keys used for signing the SOAP envelope will be provided. The keys can be provided via Java Keystore (JKS) or PEM/DER files or unencrypted Base64-encoded PEM format.
Valid values: keystore, key-files and key-data Default value: keystore

Specifies the file containing Private Key used to sign the SOAP message using the signing algorithm. The formats supported by the adapter are -
1) Base64-encoded unencrypted PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) format 2) DER (Definite Encoding Rules) format

Specifies the file containing X509 Certificate (Public Key). The formats supported by the adapter are -
1) Base64-encoded unencrypted PEM (Privacy Enhanced Mail) format 2) DER (Definite Encoding Rules) format

XML specifying the Private Key in unencrypted Base64-encoded PEM format.
Example -
<private-key-data>-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----- MIICdQIBADANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAASCAl8wggJbAgEAAoGBAKomKro6VbW4PeQtUhNzZpSH26vb BTBtH1r4EjnIv4vnhSyyA62ewpROVNn0SpvjoBFwE88HcX3tXym/zbVgtdPke9K+SYHP6CWdiLqn ........ -----END PRIVATE KEY-----</private-key-data>

XML specifying the X509 Certificate (Public Key) in unencrypted Base64-encoded PEM format.
Example -
<certificate-data>-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- MIICdzCCAeCgAwIBAgIFXseN1xYwDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEFBQAwUzELMAkGA1UEBhMC VVMxEzARBgNVBAoTCkFtYXpvbi5jb20xDDAKBgNVBAsTA0FXUzEhMB8GA1UEAxMY ........ -----END CERTIFICATE-----</certificate-data>

XML representing details of the keystore containing the public and private keys used for sigining the SOAP envelope.
Sample -
<signature-keystore> <keystore-file></keystore-file> <keystore-password></keystore-password> <alias></alias> <password></password> </signature-keystore>
Tags - <keystore-file>, </keystore-password> and </alias> are required.

Specify Character set name to encode or decode the characters. E.g. Character set Supporting Language Shift_JIS : Japanese character set. Big5 : Traditional Chinese character set. ISO-8859-2 : ISO character set for Central European languages.

An XML document representing the list of custom HTTP headers to be added to the outgoing SOAP request.
Sample XML -
<http-request-headers> <http-request-header> <name></name> <value></value> </http-request-header> <http-request-header> <name></name> <value></value> </http-request-header> . . . </http-request-headers>

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <soap-rpc-request> <wsdl-location>${wsdl location}</wsdl-location> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[endpoint address]')!=0"> <endpoint-address>${endpoint address}</endpoint-address> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[service name]')!=0"> <service-name>${service name}</service-name> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[port name]')!=0"> <port-name>${port name}</port-name> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[soap action]')!=0"> <soap-action>${soap action}</soap-action> </xsl:if> <soap-version>${soap version}</soap-version> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('$[use ssl certificate]')!=0"> <use-ssl-certificate>${use ssl certificate}</use-ssl-certificate> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <use-ssl-certificate> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">false</xsl:text> </use-ssl-certificate> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('$[install certificate]')!=0"> <install-certificate>${install certificate}</install-certificate> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <install-certificate> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">false</xsl:text> </install-certificate> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('$[allow unsigned certificate]')!=0"> <allow-unsigned-certificate>${allow unsigned certificate}</allow-unsigned-certificate> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <allow-unsigned-certificate> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">false</xsl:text> </allow-unsigned-certificate> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[truststore file]')!=0"> <truststore-file>${truststore file}</truststore-file> </xsl:if> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string('$[no truststore passphrase]')="false""> <passphrase>${pass phrase}</passphrase> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <passphrase> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">changeit</xsl:text> </passphrase> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[keystore file]')!=0"> <keystore-file>${keystore file}</keystore-file> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string('$[keystore passphrase has no input]')="false""> <keystore-passphrase>${keystore pass phrase}</keystore-passphrase> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <keystore-passphrase> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">changeit</xsl:text> </keystore-passphrase> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> <client-alias>${client alias}</client-alias> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[username token]')!=0"> <username-token>${username token}</username-token> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[user name]')!=0"> <username>${user name}</username> </xsl:if> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string('$[no password]') = "false""> <password> <xsl:attribute name="encryption-type"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('$[password encryption type]')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${password encryption type}</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">plain</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:attribute> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string('$[is password secure]') = "true"">${password}</xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">$[password]</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </password> </xsl:when> </xsl:choose> <xsl:if test="'${username token}'='true'"> <password-type>${password type}</password-type> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[nonce validation]')!=0"> <nonce-validation>${nonce validation}</nonce-validation> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[created validation]')!=0"> <created-validation>${created validation}</created-validation> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[timestamp]')!=0"> <timestamp>${timestamp}</timestamp> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[time to live]')!=0"> <time-to-live>${time to live}</time-to-live> </xsl:if> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('$[sign request]')!=0"> <sign-request>${sign request}</sign-request> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="'${sign request}'='true'"> <signature-properties> <xsl:attribute name="mode">${signature mode}</xsl:attribute> <sign-username-token>${sign username token}</sign-username-token> <sign-timestamp>${sign timestamp}</sign-timestamp> <xsl:if test="'${signature mode}'='keystore'"> <keystore-file>${signature keystore file}</keystore-file> <keystore-password>${signature keystore password}</keystore-password> <alias>${signature alias}</alias> <xsl:if test="string-length('$[signature key password]')!=0"> <password> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${signature key password}</xsl:text> </password> </xsl:if> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${signature mode}'='key-files'"> <private-key-file>${private key file}</private-key-file> <certificate-file>${certificate file}</certificate-file> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${signature mode}'='key-data'"> <private-key-data>${private key data}</private-key-data> <certificate-data>${certificate data}</certificate-data> </xsl:if> </signature-properties> </xsl:when> </xsl:choose> </xsl:when> </xsl:choose> <download-attachments> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('$[download attachments]')!=0">${download attachments}</xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">false</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </download-attachments> <invocation-mode>${invocation mode}</invocation-mode> <character-set>$[character-set]</character-set> ${http request headers} <soap-message> <xsl:for-each select="/"> <xsl:copy-of select="." /> </xsl:for-each> </soap-message> ${attachments} </soap-rpc-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: This process requires the entire SOAP envelope including the <soap:Envelope>, <soap:Header> and <soap:Body> elements when invoking a web service.
